intro: Panicum lanipes, commonly known as silky grass or silky panicum, is a species of grass native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and panicles that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its growth habit is usually clump-forming, and it can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Panicum lanipes is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
